availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Archibald Woods Kavanaugh (Madison County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer. Alabama native. Married to Dorcas Lackey Kavanaugh on June 17, 1839 in Garrard County. Father of William Kavanaugh, Mattie J. Kavanaugh, Joseph Kavanaugh, Elizabeth Kavanaugh, Susan Kavanaugh, Archibald Kavanaugh, Amelia Kavanaugh, and Lucy Kavanaugh. Owned eight enslaved people in Garrard County in 1840. Farmer in Garrard County in 1850. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Garrard County in 1850. Farmer in Garrard County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Garrard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 26.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Division 2, p. 283B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, District 2, p. 66.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 724.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 30A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Brandy Springs, District 1, p. 373A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Garrard County Marriages, Film #000183256, p. 96.
Find A Grave, "A. W. Kavanaugh (1818-1870)," Memorial #98563392, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98563392 (accessed March 12, 2020).
